---
title: Authentication
---

import Badge from "~/components/en/Badge.astro";

There are two authentication methods. One uses a username and password, obtained through the [`DEFINE USER`](https://surrealdb.com/docs/surrealdb/surrealql/statements/define/user) statement. The other is custom authentication, defined through the [`DEFINE ACCESS`](https://surrealdb.com/docs/surrealdb/surrealql/statements/define/access) statement. 
This document will refer to the former as "user authentication" and the latter as "access authentication."

### `.signin()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" />

Signs you into SurrealDB using either user authentication or access authentication.

```ts
signin(auth: Auth, options?: ClientRpcOptions): Promise<Jwt>;
```

#### Arguments

##### `auth`

Information required for either user or access authentication. The required parameters for each authentication type are:

| Authentication Type | Parameters |
| --- | ---|
| Root User | `{ user: string, pass: string }` |
| Namespace User | `{ user: string, pass: string, ns: string }` |
| Database User | `{ user: string, pass: string, ns: string, db: string }` |
| Access | `{ ac: string, ns: string, db: string, [param: string]: unknown }` |

Typically, access authentication requires additional parameters, as defined by the access (`ac`).

##### `options`

Options for the RPC request.

#### Return Value

Returns a `Promise` object that resolves to a `Jwt`.

#### Examples

The following example signs into SurrealDB as the root user:

```ts
import { Surreal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb";

const db = new Surreal();
await db.connect("ws://localhost:8000");

const jwt = await db.signin({
  user: "root",
  pass: "passw0rd",
});

console.log(jwt.issuedAt);  // e.g. 1722749786
console.log(jwt.expiresAt); // e.g. 1722753386
console.log(jwt.namespace); // undefined
console.log(jwt.database);  // undefined
console.log(jwt.access);    // undefined
console.log(jwt.user);      // 'root'

console.log(jwt.raw);             // 'eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhb ... '
console.log(JSON.stringify(jwt)); // '"[REDACTED]"'

await db.disconnect();
```

The following example signs into SurrealDB as a namespace user:

```ts
import { Surreal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb";

const db = new Surreal();
await db.connect("ws://localhost:8000");

const jwt = await db.signin({
  ns: "my_namespace",
  user: "ns_user",
  pass: "passw0rd",
});

console.log(jwt.namespace); // 'my_namespace'
console.log(jwt.database);  // undefined
console.log(jwt.access);    // undefined
console.log(jwt.user);      // 'ns_user'

await db.disconnect();
```

The following example signs into SurrealDB as a database user:

```ts
import { Surreal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb";

const db = new Surreal();
await db.connect("ws://localhost:8000");

const jwt = await db.signin({
  ns: "my_namespace",
  db: "my_database",
  user: "db_user",
  pass: "passw0rd",
});

console.log(jwt.namespace); // 'my_namespace'
console.log(jwt.database);  // 'my_database'
console.log(jwt.access);    // undefined
console.log(jwt.user);      // 'db_user'

await db.disconnect();
```

The following example signs into SurrealDB with record access. The `.user` property will be set to the record ID:

```ts
import { Surreal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb";

const db = new Surreal();
await db.connect("ws://localhost:8000");

const jwt = await db.signin({
  ns: "my_namespace",
  db: "my_database",
  ac: "account",
  // ...parameters
});

console.log(jwt.namespace); // 'my_namespace'
console.log(jwt.database);  // 'my_database'
console.log(jwt.access);    // 'account'
console.log(jwt.user);      // e.g. 'user:⟨tai-kun⟩'

await db.disconnect();
```

### `.signup()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" />

Signs up to SurrealDB using access authentication. 

```ts
signup(auth: RecordAccessAuth, options?: ClientRpcOptions): Promise<Jwt>;
```

#### Arguments

##### `auth`

Information required for access authentication. 

##### `options`

Options for the RPC request.

#### Return Value

Returns a `Promise` object that resolves to a `Jwt`.

#### Examples

```ts
import { Surreal } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb";

const db = new Surreal();
await db.connect("ws://localhost:8000");

const jwt = await db.signup({
  ns: "my_namespace",
  db: "my_database",
  ac: "account",
  // ...parameters
});

console.log(jwt.namespace); // 'my_namespace'
console.log(jwt.database);  // 'my_database'
console.log(jwt.access);    // 'account'
console.log(jwt.user);      // e.g. 'user:⟨tai-kun⟩'

await db.disconnect();
```

### `.authenticate()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" />

Authenticates the current connection using a JWT.

```ts
authenticate(token: string | Jwt, options?: ClientRpcOptions): Promise<void>
```

#### Arguments

##### `token`

The JWT to authenticate with.

##### `options`

Options for the RPC request.

#### Return Value

Returns a `Promise` object that resolves to `undefined`. 

### `.invalidate()` <Badge variant="instance" /><Badge variant="method" />

Invalidates the authentication of the current connection.

```ts
invalidate(options?: ClientRpcOptions): Promise<void>
```

#### Arguments

##### `options`

Options for the RPC request.

#### Return Value

Returns a `Promise` object that resolves to `undefined`.
